The '''White Horse''' was the emblem of the kingdom of [[Rohan]].<ref name="Gate">{{RK|Gate}}, p. 891</ref> It was depicted on a green field on the banner of Rohan<ref name="Ride">{{RK|Ride}}, p. 838</ref> and emblazoned on a shield of the [[Rohirrim]] that was given to [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]]<ref name="Muster">{{RK|Muster}}, p. 802</ref>.

== History ==
On March 10, {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 10, p. 1093</ref><ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 540</ref> [[Éowyn]] gave Merry a round shield with the device of the white horse on it<ref name="Muster"/>.

[[File:The Lord of the Rings (film series) - Rohan flag.jpg|thumb|As designed for the ''[[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|The Lord of the Rings]]'' film series]]

[[Théoden]] rode under this banner to the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]]<ref name="Muster"/><ref>{{RK|Battle}}, p. 839</ref> on March 15, {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 15, p. 1094</ref> and after his death it was flown by his nephew and successor [[Éomer]] during the rest of the battle<ref>{{RK|Battle}}, p. 847</ref> and on March 25, {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 25, p. 1094</ref> during the battle before the [[Black Gate]] of [[Mordor]] itself<ref name="Gate"/>. It continued to be carried by [[Éomer]] when he accompanied king [[Aragorn|Elessar]] with the cavalry of the Mark beyond the [[Sea of Rhûn]] or to the far fields of the South after the [[War of the Ring]] ended.<ref>{{App|Mark}}, ''Third Line'', entry for king ''Éomer Éadig'', p. 1071</ref>

== Inspiration ==
According to [[Tom Shippey]]'s ''[[The Road to Middle-earth]]'', the emblem may have been inspired from the [[Wikipedia:Uffington White Horse|Uffington White Horse]].<ref>Tom Shippey, ''[[The Road to Middle-earth]]'', "Chapter 4: A Cartographic Plot", pp. 140 and 150</ref>

The White Horse is a recurring motif in mythology and prehistoric English culture. See [[Wikipedia:Leucippotomy|leucippotomy]].
